frame.name: Craft
frame.definition:
<def-root>A particular <fen>Activity</fen>, performed conventionally or habitually by more than one <fen>Practitioner</fen> within a <fen>Culture</fen>, is described in terms of its method.
<ex>One lived-in cabin also had a grassy roof, as if the <t>craft</t> <fex name="Act">of thatching</fex> had died out locally</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the <fen>Activity</fen> that is being performed habitually or conventionally.
<ex> Restrop was built at the very height of the great Elizabethan age, when the <t>craft</t> <fex name="Act">of building</fex> began to turn into an art.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Practitioner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose <fen>Activity</fen> is at issue.
<ex>The development and the elaboration of metal armour for protection in warfare and jousting gave considerable impetus to the <t>craft</t> <fex name="Prac">of the blacksmith</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Activity</fen> is performed.
<ex>So, by application of the sacred <fex name="Plc">northern</fex> <t>art</t> of fettling, here are a few tips on how to provide your steed with an almost Zen-like ride quality</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate attributes, traits, or evaluations of the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<ex>Once upon a time people indulged in the <fex name="Desc">ages-old</fex> <t>craft</t> of telling stories to each other</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Culture
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Culture</fen> within which the Activity is performed.
<ex>Origami is an ancient <fex name="Culture">Japanese</fex> <t>craft</t> of paper folding</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: art.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an activity with an aesthetic component requiring knowledge and skill

lexUnit.name: craft.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an activity involving skill in making things by hand.

lexUnit.name: science.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a procedurally complex activity requiring methodical attention to detail
